text: well we understand that if sergeant law
Azaria was going to be acquitted that
would have been made clear at the
beginning of this verdict statement and
certainly what's happening at the moment
the lead judge in this case
Colonel Maya Heller has been going
through in her verdicts statements
taking apart different points of the
defense case one by one and she has
already said that this Palestinian man
who was wounded Abdul Fattah Sharif who
was shot on the 24th of March last year
by sergeant Azaria that he was short
needlessly in the view of the judges and
she also said that the sergeant had
given evolving and evasive testimony in
this case of course the defense case was
that the sergeant believed that Sharif
who was lying on the ground and was
still moving slightly posed a threat he
said that he thought that he could have
had a suicide belt on underneath his
jacket the prosecution said that he
acted in revenge killing this wounded
man with a single shot to the head about
15 minutes after he was shot by other
soldiers because he'd been involved in
this knife attack
